alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued January 12 at 3:38AM PST until January 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...South winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Portions of the Shasta Valley. This includes Interstate 5, US Highway 97, and the communities of Weed and Grenada. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. A few power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The winds will largely be tied to the land falling location of a low pressure system, so guidance is mixed. Confidence is medium (50%) for winds of at least 55 mph. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Dangerous driving conditions are possible, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Downed trees and power lines are possible. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Central Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County
